confused.translate: спутанный, смущенный, сбивчивый, беспорядочный, поставленный в тупик
examples: I've never been so confused.
She looked a wee bit confused.
If you're confused about anything, phone me.
She felt hopelessly confused.
We're confused about what to do next.
Never had she been so confused.
I was confused to learn of his latest decision.
We were confused by all the legal mumbo jumbo.
I'm totally confused. Could you explain that again?
Her remarks confused the debate.
confused by the embedded Latin quotations
The incident left her feeling confused and hurt.
He kept asking unnecessary questions which only confused the issue.
Disinflation is not to be confused with deflation, where prices actually drop.
She was in an extremely confused state of mind.
The new evidence only confused matters further.
She assumed from his expression that he was confused.
The constant attention of the young man confused her.
We were confused by the ambiguous wording of the message.
The teacher confused the student with too many questions.
Witness statements presented a confused picture of the incident.
Donald Regan, not to be confused with former President Ronald Reagan.
A writer of considerable perception, she remembers how it feels to be confused and insecure.
I was confused by the legalese in the contract.
Impossibility should never be confused with improbability.
example_translate: Я никогда не был в таком замешательстве.

Никогда она не была так смущена.
Я пришёл в замешательство, когда узнал о его последнем решении.
Нас сбила с толку вся эта юридическая белиберда.
Я совершенно запутался. Не могли бы вы объяснить ещё раз?
Её замечания завели дискуссию в тупик.
в смущении от включённых туда латинских цитат
Это происшествие оставило её с чувством стыда и обиды.

Дезинфляцию не надо путать с дефляцией, в условиях которой цены действительно падают.
